content:
The Sand Harbor to Memorial Point trail is an excellent choice for photography enthusiasts. The trail offers stunning views of Lake Tahoe, and the scenery is particularly beautiful during the fall season when the aspens and other trees change colors.

That's impressive that you completed a 5-day, 2,400-mile road trip from Yellowstone to San Francisco in your Honda Pilot! Sacramento is a great stopover, and I'm glad you enjoyed your lunch break there.

For your upcoming trip to Lake Tahoe, I recommend arriving early at Sand Harbor to secure parking, as it can get crowded during peak season. The trail is relatively easy, and the scenery is breathtaking, with the lake's crystal-clear waters and surrounding mountains making for fantastic photo opportunities.

Some tips for your hike:

* Bring a camera with a good zoom lens to capture the stunning vistas.
* Wear comfortable shoes or hiking boots, as the trail can be uneven in some areas.
* Pack snacks and water, as there are no amenities along the trail.
* Be mindful of your surroundings and keep an eye out for wildlife, including bears and snakes.
* Take your time and enjoy the views!

If you have time, consider stopping by the nearby Kings Beach or Tahoe City for lunch or snacks. Both towns offer a variety of restaurants and cafes with great views of the lake.

Have a great time on your hike, and I hope you capture some amazing photos!
